primary_factors: No accumulating snow or meaningful wintry precip expected (rain/fog setup; snowfall forecast 0")
Temperatures stay above freezing around bus time (~33.7–34.2°F); wind chill near ~29–31°F (no extreme-cold closure trigger)
Primary hazard is fog/low stratus 2–9 AM: prevailing ~1 mile visibility with pockets possibly <0.5 mile (localized), which usually leads to “open with caution” rather than closure in Michigan
Roads/plow operations: roads already clear; no plowing needed; only isolated bridge/overpass slick-spot risk (not widespread ice)
Decision signals: no active closings/delays on a major local TV closings page; no neighboring-district weather closures found; Rockford communications currently indicate school resumes Feb 17
Power: only small, scattered outages reported countywide (~82 customers in Kent County) — not a districtwide closure driver
decision_rationale: All expert inputs align on a non-snow, above-freezing morning with fog as the main operational issue. Meteorology and web verification both show mid-30s temperatures and feels-like around ~29–32°F during 6–9 AM, with 0" snow and no extreme cold—so Michigan’s main closure triggers (ice storm, blizzard/heavy snow, or ≤-20°F wind chill) are not present. Safety and infrastructure agree the credible hazard is reduced visibility during the bus window, plus isolated slick spots on bridges/overpasses if microclimates briefly touch ~32°F; that profile more often produces slower routes or, at most, a short delay rather than a full closure. News intelligence shows no active closings/delays on a local TV closings page at this time and no confirmed neighboring-district weather closures; additionally, several nearby districts being off for mid-winter break weakens any ‘domino’ closure signal. Power-grid risk is low: only scattered outages countywide, not a widespread event. Given Michigan’s high bar for full closures and the lack of snow/ice/extreme cold, the best Brier-optimized call is a low single-digit closure probability, with monitoring for localized dense fog/spot-ice that could instead justify a delay.

collaboration.summary: Agents reached consensus after 1 round(s) with 1.0% spread. Average probability: 6%.
